Class FilterController

java.lang.Object
controller.FilterController
public class FilterController extends Object
Controller responsible for filtering issues based on multiple criteria such as status, priority, author, date range, ID, and title. Displays the results in a list and supports opening an issue in the main window. Initializes UI controls, keyboard shortcuts, and list cell rendering.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • FilterController

      public FilterController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the filter view once the FXML is loaded. Sets up tooltips, keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl/Cmd + Enter for filtering, Ctrl/Cmd + O to open selected issue), configures list cell behavior, loads ComboBox contents, and sets up event handlers for double-clicking an issue.

    • onFilterButtonClicked

      void onFilterButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Performs filtering based on the currently selected or entered criteria: status, priority, author, date range, ID fragment, and title. The results are updated in the results list.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the filter button (may be null when triggered by keyboard shortcut)

    • setParent

      public void setParent(MainAppWindowController mainWindowController)
      Sets the parent controller to allow navigation to issue details and access to the IssueManager.
      Parameters:
      mainWindowController - the parent main application window controller

    • setExceptionListerner

      public void setExceptionListerner(ChildControllerListener eventListerner)
      Sets the exception listener so child controller errors can be forwarded to the main application for handling.
      Parameters:
      eventListerner - the listener to notify on errors

    • refreshIssues

      public void refreshIssues()
      Refreshes the ListView of filtered issues. Useful when external changes occur that modify the displayed issues (e.g., issue edited elsewhere).
